channel.title: The Leech Thread
channel.description: The guard in the beginning of Forget About Freeman says somethings about "swimming in thw waters with shit and leeches" once you get him to the ladder. since leeches are cut, this dialogue is irrelevant. What to do about it?

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: BendyBread
item.description:
I didn’t like them either. They were just there for the sake of it I feel.

Now that Black Mesa has amazingly scary/murky water, I feel like that’s enough to kind of set the mood without re-introducing pests that feel like the equivalent of flies on a hot day.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: No_Stress
item.description:
The leeches in the original were a pest, not hard at all, but just really annoying and no fun whatsoever. I’m glad they were cut.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
They made it into a particle effect to reduce the amount of entities. They’re pushing the entity limit as it is.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: Xeoxer
item.description:
Roaches’ size is too small for a model, but in real life cockroaches are quite big. Roaches in BM seem to be even smaller than flies. Maybe if they were enlarged, they would become an NPC and be killable?

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
Specifically, they were made into particle effects, and you can’t kill particle effects.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
I’m not an expert on Hammer or the limits of the Source engine, so I can accept that logic.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
Something about entity limits and whatnot.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
MSKyuuni:

They weren’t omitted; in the “would’ve let you in” room in Office Complex, they’re running around near the vending machine, but they’re really tiny and you can’t kill them.

Hardly noticeable apparently, as I totally missed them.

So I’ll restructure my inquiry. Since their appearance was far more minimalist than what was in the original game, why in particular was their presence downsized to noninteractive?

It’s obvious that they weren’t exactly a core mechanic of great importance, but it’s still, more or less as much of a noticeable omission to that of the leeches.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: SiCaRiO
item.description:
darkone:

almost every game developer ever… I could find one or 2 games in each that have a enemy that can kill you but you can’t kill example leaches in half life 2 and the glowing antlion guard in ep2.

leeches in half life 2 were not an enemy, they were walls designed to keep the player from going to far into the water.

leeches are enemys in half life and killale, as they should in BM

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: sgtpieman
item.description:
…You could kill the antlion guard in ep2. You just had to wait to be allowed to kill it. Now that I think about it though, why couldn’t you kill it again? I believe the extract was from a hive, not the guard.

That is weird though how playtesters couldn’t see the leeches. Those areas for me seem almost too bright. Maybe I just have the brightness on my monitor too high.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: SiCaRiO
item.description:
darkone:

think what that was talking about, is the fact that they where a random entity like the roaches you couldn’t kill them they just did damage to the player at random till they where down to 10 health… I read that some where forget where think it was the wiki.

also off topic side note you can kill the roaches, by hitting them with a weapon that makes a bullet impact texture (over rides the roach)

who in their right minds would design an enemy that can damage you but you cant kill?

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: MSKyuuni
item.description:
Maxx Skywalker:

Is there a reason why the roaches were omitted? Surely they weren’t nearly as much of a nuisance as the leeches, nor did they do damage to the player.

They weren’t omitted; in the “would’ve let you in” room in Office Complex, they’re running around near the vending machine, but they’re really tiny and you can’t kill them.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker

…or by stepping on them. crunch

Is there a reason why the roaches were omitted? Surely they weren’t nearly as much of a nuisance as the leeches, nor did they do damage to the player.

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: sgtpieman
item.description:
I don’t really see why they were removed either. They aren’t a complex enemy, and it makes almost no difference whether they are there not. I think the answer could lie within another question. Were they removed, or were they just not put in?

item.title: The Leech Thread

item.description:
in truth I didn’t know that they where removed, never payed any attention to them in half life either.

Read full topic

item.title: The Leech Thread
item.dc:creator: SiCaRiO
item.description:
Dr. Karamazov:

Why a dumb idea? They’re hardly an integral part of the game. The devs had far more important things to get on with.

Did you cry when you noticed that they weren’t in the game? I bet you raged and smashed your monitor. It’s a real game breaker isn’t it. :fffuuu:

Its an enemy, it makes water levels more interesting, and leeches ae far more important than dumb over the top “on prupose” voice acting for Hecu.

Mangled*:

I, for one, was very glad that they were cut.

From a design standpoint they had little value in the original, providing nothing other than a minor irritation for the water sections.

From a logical standpoint they didn’t make any sense and nor did combatting them.

  • If they’re terrestrial leeches, how did they even get to a perfectly functioning underground science facility in the middle of the desert?[COLOR=‘Red’]They are from Xen
  • What kind of state of the art environmental hazard protection suit with reactive armor would be prone to leeches, terrestrial or otherwise?[COLOR=‘Red’]Leeches consume suit energy, also, What kind of state of the art environmental hazard protection suit with reactive armor would be prone to claw attacks from zombies, vorts and kicks from human soldiers?
  • You can’t swing a crowbar underwater proficiently enough to kill a leech in real life.[COLOR=‘Red’]Is this real life?
  • Why, for the love of jesus christ, would you be fucking about trying to kill leaches in the middle of an alien invasion? Priorities, Freeman.[COLOR=‘Red’]same reason why you kill roaches?

I’m going to assert that they are not missed by the silent majority.

Read full topic
